description: 1 + the number of unitary and squarefree divisors of n = number of divisors of reduced squarefree part of n.
comments: Note that 1 is regarded as free of prime squares and also a square number and it is also a unitary divisor.
formula: Multiplicative with a(p)=2 and a(p^e)=1 for e>1. a(n)=2^A056169(n). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 01 2001
example: n=252=2.2.3.3.7 has 18 divisors, 8 unitary and 8 squarefree divisors of which 2 are unitary and squarefree,divisors {1,7}; n=2520=2.2.2.3.3.5.7 has 48 divisors,16 unitary and 16 squarefree divisors of which {1,5,7,35}, i.e. a(2520)=4a(2520)=a(2^3*3^2*5*7)=a(2^3)*a(3^2)*a(5)*a(7)=1*1*2*2=4.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 10 2000
